content.title: Midaortic Syndrome (Middle Aortic Syndrome)
content.definition: Segmental narrowing of the abdominal aorta, typically with involvement of renal and/or visceral arteries, presenting as severe hypertension in children and young adults.

key_concepts.description: Idiopathic (most common), neurofibromatosis type 1, Williams syndrome, Takayasu arteritis, fibromuscular dysplasia, radiation arteritis.
Severe refractory hypertension, upper/lower extremity blood pressure gradient, abdominal bruits, claudication (rare in children).
Renal artery stenosis (70-80%), mesenteric artery stenosis (30-50%), coarctation of thoracic aorta.

imaging.ultrasound: Renal artery velocities, segmental aortic velocities

medical.agents: ACE inhibitors, ARBs (caution if bilateral RAS), calcium channel blockers, beta-blockers

endovascular.techniques: Angioplasty (± stent for recoil), renal artery stenting
endovascular.limitations: Restenosis common in children, stents do not grow

surgical.indication: Long-segment disease, failed endovascular, need for definitive repair

options.renal_revascularization: Aortorenal bypass (autologous vein or artery), reimplantation

surgical.conduit: Autologous internal iliac artery or vein preferred, grows with child

surgical_considerations.growth: Use autologous conduits when possible - prosthetic grafts do not grow
surgical_considerations.staged_procedures: May require staged renal then aortic repair

outcomes.long_term: Surveillance required for progression and graft growth

content.statement: Midaortic Syndrome (Middle Aortic Syndrome) is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pediatric-Vascular that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Midaortic Syndrome (Middle Aortic Syndrome) include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Midaortic Syndrome (Middle Aortic Syndrome).

learning_objectives: Describe diagnostic workup including imaging modalities
Explain surgical options for aortic and renal reconstruction
Discuss special considerations for pediatric vascular reconstruction
clinical_pearls: Think of MAS in any child with severe hypertension
Autologous conduit is essential for growing children
Staged procedures may be needed for complex disease
